title: ISic000660. I.Sicily inscription 000660
body:
1[cross_uninterpreted Hic requiesc]it in pace bo(nae) m(emoriae) Entolius
2[famul(us)? sanctae? Ro]m(anae) eccl(esiae) qui vixit pl(us) m(inus) ann(is) L
3[depositus mense I]unio d(ie) secunda ind(ictione) se-
4[cunda?] vac.

1[.............]ITINPACEBOMENTOLIUS
2[...............]MECCLQUIVIXITPLMANNL
3[...............]UNIODSECUNDAINDSE
4[.....]      

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Manganaro 2006;
  • 2: Symbol for 50 appears to be an acutely angled L with a diagonally crossing line

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Here lies in peace Entolius of good memory. Servant of the holy Roman church, who lived 50 years more or less, laid to rest in the month of June, on the second day, in the second indiction.

commentary

The text is reported as part of the collection of V. Cammarata (Enna), but Manganaro at no point attributes it to a local context, and in the 2006 publication assumes that it has a Roman provenance, not a Sicilian one.

bibliography

  • 2006.0516 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • 1993.0833 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • Manganaro 1993 573 n.59 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001827
  • Manganaro 2006 132-133 no.2 ph https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001798
